EveNamn: Bringing international experiences on sustainability to KTH
EveBesk:
Bringing international experiences on sustainability to KTH Welcome to the Sustainability Council of May 2nd
In this council we will have student speakers sharing international perpsectives on sustainability based on their experiences
After their talks we will have a workshop to we how we can get inspired by them amplify the international experiences within KTH and see what kinds of actions we can take

As always every student that is interested in the topic can attend whether you are part of an organisation or an individual At the beginning of the Council we have 15 minutes of fika to meet the other participants and network If you want to come and so that we dont waste food you need to sign up by April 29th in this sign up sheet httpsformsglezVFaYiVqsmsY552YA

Since we are having fika you are encouraged to bring your own reusable cup to cut down the waste from the event

Collaborating for a Resilient Future Join Futurice and guests at Engelbrektsgatan 7 in Stockholm on May 16th to explore how your business can overcome common challenges find new business opportunities and excel by collaborating towards a resilient future

Large organisations have a vast expansive reach and impact our planet and its inhabitants in both positive and negative ways Despite strong motivation from many organisations to achieve sustainability targets legacy systems and departmental silos can make it challenging to simultaneously do right by the people the planet and the business A systemic approach to sustainability requires strong partnerships collaboration and continuous sharing of knowledge

The time has come for businesses and organisations to join efforts to build a resilient future  for the people the business and the planet

In this event Futurice Stockholm comes together with Telia and Sandra Runsten to examine the ambitious goals of large organisations We will explore how new ways of working can help us collaboratively meet the needs of people and the planet whilst exploring opportunities for business growth now and into the future

The Bloody Taboo  A discussion about Menstrual Health Rag Ekibadha Marchese Rojo Lingonveckan Amar shorir kharap‚Ä¶No this isn‚Äôt a weird list of random words these are all the words you can use to call something that happens to women and girls every months Words that substitute the word Menstruation Why Because Menstruation is considered disgusting a women‚Äôs issue something you cannot talk about in public something to be ashamed of It is something you should hide even using ‚Äúcryptic‚Äù words that just fellow women can understand Menstruation is a taboo wherever you go on this planet A taboo that limits women‚Äôs and girls‚Äô lives health and freedom to achieve their goals Breaking this bloody taboo is therefore fundamental to free girls from shame and discomfort allowing them to take care of their health properly and reach everything they want in life This event is part of an international movement that aims to destroy every taboo and limitation society has constructed around Menstruation yelling out loud OUR PERIODS MATTER WE MATTER AND MENSTRUATION NEEDS CELEBRATION NOT SHAME
Discover with us what menstruation means for women all around the world what they need to face everyday and join the movement of change that is breaking the Bloody Taboo

The event will start with the screening of four short movies made by SafeHands For Mothers followed by a panel discussion Stay tuned to discover who the panelists will be

EveBesk:
The CAP Talks ‚Äì Guest lecture series The Master in Communication programme is holding a guest lecture series The CAP Talks that deals with organizational discourse in various professional settings including culture higher education peacekeeping and human rights The lectures are held as part of the organizational communication course Communication among professionals but they are also open to all students and staff at the department Please find more detailed descriptions of the lectures below



GLOCAL WORK AT UNA SWEDEN
Tuesday April 30 13001500 room Quark

Working in closely intertwined local and global settings the President of the United Nations Association of Sweden Annelie B√∂rjesson often finds herself in everchanging contexts with new people and a diverse range of topics Obviously the appropriate communication also varies from situation to situation This lecture will shed light on some of the challenges and situations that might occur in such a dynamic organizational environment as UNA Sweden Moreover Annelie will share some personal experiences and helpful communication techniques



EXPERT PANEL x0003COMMUNICATORS IN ACADEMIA
Thursday May 9 13001500 room Quark

Saida Hajee School of Business Economics and Law GU Peter Larsson Department of Applied IT GU and Tobias Karlsson G√∂ta Studentk√•r all share a job title communicator But what does being a communicator x0003mean in practice How does the organizational context the x0003three panelists work in shape their tasks and working routines x0003How do experience as well as educational and professional x0003background influence how communicators approach their job x0003set priorities and deal with challenges This panel discussion x0003provides insights into the work of a communicator from three x0003different perspectives in and around academia ‚Äì questions x0003and contributions from the audience are most welcome



AUDIENCE DEVELOPMENT AT MALM√ñ OPERA
Thursday May 16 13001500 room Quark

On May 17 we open the Blue Sea with the surrounding area for the 28th edition of UK

Mythopoetics is a new approach to the development of healing arts as well as the art of psychic healing It integrates Jungian and Gestalt approaches to therapy with physical creative performance practices
Mythopoetics invites artistic and healing practitioners  through physical performance practices  to devise their own mythic elements These mythic elements then evolve into dramatic forms first solo then in dyads then in small groups Throughout the work dual attention is given both to the safety of a therapeutic boundary and to artistic freedom arising from the transpersonal nature of poetry and metaphor

Koz Dos Painting Live Hit  Run is an art project where artists come and go to the gallery during a six month period They are painting live both indoors and outdoors The idea is for visitors to come close and experience the creative process and the artists Hit and run is all about beauty in the creative process and how it brings people together In this way we can better understand the genre of Street Art and show our support to the art form and enable the artists to work
Norra Station believes that art can change the world and creative people is a way of saving it

WE ARE NOW VERY VERY VERY PROUD TO PRESENT THE NEXT ARTIST KOZDOS
Koz Dos is a Venezuelan graffiti writer who had his beginnings in his home town of Caracas Passing first through the graffitiwriter bombs and tags he developed his technique into a representative and figurative style graffiti

The latter carrying him to study the image the drawing the color and different techniques making his work more conceptual and symbolic He created characters that bind the realistic with flat figures such as circles triangles and lines In his works the segments are created with flat color sectors which are completed with the addition of figures and backgrounds

The mixture of two realities in this case human and nature shows the confrontation between man and nature the rational human thoughtful and methodical against spontaneous nature This is reflected in animals looking for a kind of coexistence a harmony
a unification ManAnimal and vice versa

This does not exist in real life creating a new dialogue with the viewer with the intention that the art the graffiti should invoke questions from the viewer

Koz Dos has displayed his work at national and international exhibitions One of his first international events was held in Ecuador He later participated in other events in Latin America such as Colombia Brazil and Chile Outside of Latin America we can also find his large murals in Germany France Austria Italy Spain Cyprus and the United States

Get your ticket now httpswwwnorticsedagnyevent21010

When Lund Sweden on the 24th26th of May 2019

This weekend will gather participants from organisations dedicated to International affairs development and business all over the Nordics It will be a weekend filled with interesting lectures seminars and workshops on Nordic cooperation and the Nordics place in the world  and an amazing gala dinner

Bokhistoriska f√∂rel√§sningar med Jill Bepler och Mara Wade Jill Bepler Herzog August Bibliothek Wolfenb√ºttel f√∂rel√§ser om det s√• kallade Prinsessbiblioteket idag vid Staatsbibliothek zu Berlin med bland annat b√∂cker som tillh√∂rt den svenska prinsessan Sofia Albertina Mara Wade University of Illinois f√∂rel√§ser om emblematik i Georg Rems verk Inscriptiones pictur√¶ et emblemata  fr√•n ca 1620 F√∂redragen h√•lls p√• engelska
F√∂rel√§sningarna √§r √∂ppna f√∂r alla Mycket v√§lkomna

Open lectures on book history
Jill Bepler Herzog August Bibliothek Wolfenb√ºttel ‚ÄùUncovering women‚Äôs libraries in early modern Germany Princesses and their books‚Äù

Why and how did women‚Äôs book collections become invisible in the 16th and 17th century and why is the history of court libraries predominantly a history of books passed down in the male lines of royalty and the nobility Funeral sermons and inventories give us insight into hitherto unregistered book ownership by women in the early modern Germanspeaking territories A close examination of surviving books and book catalogues as well as some of the archival material connected to pivotal stages in a woman‚Äôs life ‚Äì marriage widowhood and death ‚Äì looks in detail at how books moved over vast distances and how collections were dispersed Whereas archival documents reveal patterns of inheritances and cultural transfer extant copies of women‚Äôs books can reveal practices of marking ownership and reading itself

Mara Wade University of Illinois ‚ÄùThe Hybrid Book Georg Rem‚Äôs Inscriptiones pictur√¶ et emblemata  c1620‚Äù

The Newberry Library Chicago possesses a remarkable customized book ‚ÄúInscriptiones pictur√¶ et emblemata‚Äù that places the emblems from the Great Hall of the N√ºrnberg Town Hall in the context of public monuments in the Free Imperial City1 The author of this hybrid manuscript and printed book was Georg Rem 15671625 an Augsburg patrician who around 1600 became a Ratskonsulent in N√ºrnberg and Kurator at the nearby Academy later university at Altdorf Rem‚Äôs volume has a printed book at its center accompanied by further manuscripts The printed book is flanked by sixty and fiftytwo handwritten pages respectively The inserted imprint Emblemata Politica records the emblems designed by Rem and painted into the Great Hall in 1613 The artist Peter Isselburg 1580‚Äì1630 then engraved and published them as Emblemata Politicain 1617

At the core of the volume are two presentations of the emblems first the manuscript and then the printed version Rem positioned the town hall emblems within the greater rhetorical framework of N√ºrnberg‚Äôs public good and enveloped the printed emblem book with manuscript descriptions of major public works from 1521 forward Rem carefully composed this splendid volume demonstrating that he considered the emblems to be far more than merely an ornamental addition to a storied civic space He clearly saw his emblematic program as the most recent element of an entire political philosophy in which humanistic ideals shaped the common weal His volume demonstrates that the cultural impact of any single work is amplified by the whole As the continuing Latin title of his book states the inscriptions pictures and emblems function in synergy with the triumphal arches commemorative coins and other civic monuments The emblems have a later connection to Sweden since Carl Gustav Wrangel used some of Rem‚Äôs emblems to embellish the ceremonial weapons he had made while in N√ºrnberg for the negotiations in 16491650 These are today at Skokloster With this carefully customized book Rem posits that poetry and art are indispensable to society

My paper will analyze the materiality of the book trace as far as possible its provenance and suggest some ideas for its creation

1 httpspublicationsnewberryorgdigitalemblematapoliticavaultwingms279

EveNamn: WiseMotion workshops in Stockholm open level

WiseMotion workshops in Stockholm open level WiseMotionworkshops at the Marikas Dans  Modestudio

wwwwisemotioncocom
httpwisemotioncocom20190208stockholm

Video about the WiseMotion workshop in Berlin
httpswwwyoutubecomwatchvgbbgqxxKdrAfeatureyoutube

WiseMotion is a method developed by Hanna Poikonen PhD in neuroscience of dance and music University of Helsinki which improves physical abilities selfawareness and nonverbal communication with the means of movement and neuroscience The structure of each workshops is following We start with a guided movement improvisation after which Hanna tells about the movement experience from the point of view of neuroscience Shell also go through shortly how certain imbalances of the body and brain can be alleviated by movement breathing and music In the end we have time for a group conversation

Saturday May 4th
1400 ‚Äì 1530 The Brain Intertwined Cognition Emotion and Movement relieving stress
1530 ‚Äì 1700 Attention Concentration and the Brain maintaining the healthy functioning of the brain in aging

Sunday May 5th
1200 ‚Äì 1330 Emotions in the Body and Brain alleviating anxiety and low mood
1330 ‚Äì 1500 Calming down breathing and sleep alleviating sleeping problems

You can participate in one workshop ‚Äì or in all of them
Price of one workshop is SEK 450
Two workshops SEK 750
All four workshops SEK 1400
Students unemployed and retired 15

Youll receive a course certificate of your participation

Enrolment by email to Hanna hannawisemotioncocom  You can also buy your ticket directly in httpsholvicomshopwisemotion

Please spread the word so that we can have together a great dance experience

WiseMotion
WiseMotion is a method developed by Dr Hanna Poikonen which improves physical abilities selfawareness and nonverbal communication with the means of movement and neuroscience WiseMotion workshop includes guided improvisation neuroscientific explanation of the experience and a group conversation On a WiseMotion workshop experience and knowledge come together and deepen understanding by utilizing the wisdom of both subjective experience and objective knowledge
Hanna has taught WiseMotion to all ages from 15 to 82 in English Spanish and Finnish and in North America Europe and Asia WiseMotion has toured in conferences in Harvard Medical School United States and Swissotel Berlin Germany and in festivals and institutions such as Kuopio Dance Festival Finland Iris Hong Kong Magnesia Helsinki Institut del Teatre Barcelona and Alive Wellness Hong Kong The next destinations for the 2019 are Six Senses Resorts Turkey Joint Dynamics Hong Kong and University of Toronto Canada

WiseMotion Explorers is made for all curious movers regardless their background in movement or neuroscience On the WiseMotion Explorers workshop the movement material is designed to promote processes in creativity imagination selfawareness and natural embodied collaboration In addition the physical abilities such as muscle tension and relaxation as well as balance are improved The workshop starts by bringing attention to the breath Slowly we invite the body to calm movement focusing on the bodily sensations During improvisation we move smoothly with partner and group exercises and individual creative movement Everyone moves on their own level of skills and fitness Music accompanies the workshop from breathing to the end of the movement improvisation Beautiful melodies sounds of nature and rhythmic structures create a harmonic atmosphere

The neuroscientific material and group conversation aim to improve general wellbeing by increasing understanding which is crucial in maintaining physically and mentally vital and meaningful everyday life During the neuroscientific presentation Hanna clarifies the knowledge by practical examples and connects the latest scientific discoveries to everyday life During the group conversation everyone gets an opportunity to share ones thoughts and feelings related to the topic of the workshop dance and neuroscience

WiseMotion method reaches towards the deeper layers of being which go well beyond the words In creative movement the fundamental elements of humanity are combined in a natural way Physical activity rhythm of music and movement creative act collaboration and caring touch On the WiseMotion workshop we utilize these elements to create a holistic experience

Hanna Poikonen PhD
Hanna Poikonen is originally from Finland but dance science and curiosity have brought her to live in Singapore Australia Switzerland and Costa Rica For several years already she is based in Barcelona which is a fascinating hub for the versatile methods in movement combining the theoretical approach common in North Europe and North America to the strong lived experience of South European and Latin American movement scenes

She started dancing from the street styles going through modern to contemporary dance She has studied dance in the cities such as New York Gibney Dance Movement Research Barcelona La Caldera Institut del Teatre Monreal CircuitEst centre chor√©graphique and Berlin Marameo Explorations in kung fu tai chi butoh and somatic methods have taught her a holistic approach to the body and mind

Hanna pursued her PhD degree on neuroscience of dance and music in May 2018 Faculty of Medicine University of Helsinki Finland Before that she worked for 5 years with brain research and education in the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology ETH Zurich focusing on the neuroscience of learning pain and creativity

Outside of dance and science she loves to spend time with the family and friends learn about different cultures eat well and have adventures in the raw nature from tropics to the arctic zone

EveNamn: Walden visar Joyce Wieland  Amy Taubin
EveBesk:
Walden visar Joyce Wieland  Amy Taubin This filmprogram brings together two very prominent people within the American and Canadian alternative art and film communities Eminent film critic underground actress and performance artist Amy Taubin made a few forays into the world of filmmaking and her most well known work is In the Bag from 1981 In the words of film scholar and theorist No√´l Carroll ‚ÄúRoughly twenty minutes long the film records a search through a tattered patchworkquilt shoulder bag for something ‚Äì we know not what Like Michael Snows Wavelength a film many misremember as a single tracking shot In the Bag is also easily misremembered and wrongly described as a stationary long take √† la Warhol which relentlessly records Taubins relentless rummaging However in fact the film is intensively edited ‚Äì full of what we come to understand as flash forwards and crosscuts between the primary search set on a brown table and an almost identical search set on and amid the blue sheets of a bed Taubin ‚Äì her ‚Äúcoldpreoccupied‚Äù shoulder to the camera her face generally occluded from us by her long brown hair ‚Äì is the only person in the film her manner is concentrated suggesting a total obliviousness to onlookers This plus her silence and the methodical character of her search gives In the Bag a meditative air which in turn places the film on a continuum with Taubins solitary performance pieces ‚Äì all solo meditations on the nature of the self‚Äù

Alongside In the Bag will be shown Reason over Passion 1969 the feature length magnum opus of Canadian painter and filmmaker Joyce Wieland A tour de force of invention and passion Reason over Passion can be seen as an amalgamated and richly stratified meditation on the vast Canadian landscape patriotism nationalism ecology often rendered with wry humor and political satire strongly present in many of Wielands films Structurally and formally rigorous and with a multifarious use of sound and textual language Reason over Passion is one of the key works of North American experimental filmmaking of the late 1960s

Reason Over Passion is Joyce Wielands major film so far With its many eccentricities it is a glyph of her artistic personality a lyric vision tempered by an aggressive form and a visionary patriotism mixed with ironic self parody It is a film to be seen many times  P Adams Sitney Film Culture

Films

In the Bag 1981 21 min 16mm

Reason over Passion 1969 83 min 16mm

Biographies

Amy Taubin born September 10 1939 is an American film critic She is a contributing editor for Sight  Sound and Film Comment She has also written regularly for The Village Voice The Millennium Film Journal and Artforum and used to be curator of video and film at the nonprofit experimental performance space The Kitchen

Joyce Wieland 193198 was one of Canada‚Äôs most influential artists and produced works in a variety of media including sculptures quilts tapestries paintings and films all celebrating her joy for life and reflecting her feminist leanings and passion for her beloved country She turned to experimental filmmaking while living in New York City 196270 Her filmspolitical inventive and infused with a newfound sense of nationalismincluded Rat Life and Diet in North America 1968 in which gerbils represented US political prisoners who had escaped to Canada Some of her other notable films include Water Sark 1965 Solidarity 1973 and A and B in Ontario 1984 codirected with longtime friend and colleague Hollis Frampton A monograph on her work  The Films of Joyce Wieland  was published by Cinematheque Ontario in 1999 and edited by Kathryn Elder

Curators Elisabeth Millqvist och Mattias Givell

Not a Single Story ‚Äì Place for Other Stories at The Wan√•s Foundation in 2019
On May 5 2019 the sculpture park Wan√•s Konst will open Not a Single Story an exhibition with artists who consider the site historiography and identity from a multitude of perspectives The starting point and inspiration for the title comes from author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie‚Äôs wellknown Ted Talk that she begins ‚ÄúI am a storyteller And I would like to tell you a few personal stories about what I like to call ‚Äòthe Danger of the Single Story‚Äô‚Äù Not a Single Story is a further development of the exhibition with the same title curated by the leadership duo behind Wan√•s Konst for The Nirox Foundation a sculpture park outside Johannesburg in 2018 The majority of the artists active in South Africa as well as in Sweden and internationally also contributed to the first exhibition For Wan√•s Konst in Sweden the exhibition is developed and concentrated with new works and some new artists it gives room for other stories

EveNamn: Filmvisning och samtal The Hand at Work part 1
EveBesk:
Filmvisning och samtal The Hand at Work part 1 The Hand at Work part 1
Sunday 5 May 2pm

Organised by Sarah Browne and Jenny Richards

Join us for the first in a series of screenings at Mint that looks for the bodys place in contemporary labour relations

The Hand at Work part 1 is a film screening and discussion that takes a close study of Giorgi Gago Gagoshidze film The Invisible Hand of My Father 24 minutes 2018 paired with Sarah Brownes The Invisible Limb 20 minutes 2014 In both films the hand can be seen as the narrator drawing us to the distinct ways it has been employed and conceptualised

The films allow us to consider the symbolic resonance of the hand within different workplaces and political systems in dialogue with the intimate affect of work on the body Both refer to a phantom limb either as bodily sensation or as metaphor This emphasises aspects of worker experience that may be lost or defy verification even if they are keenly felt Whose hands and what types of labour are registered in representations of work Screened at MINT and within the workplace of ABF how might we speculate and reconsider the hands imaginary and importance within working struggle today

This is the first in a series of screenings with Mint that feels for the bodys place in contemporary labour relations from intersectional feminist positions

The Invisible Hand at Work part 2 deepens conversations and questions raised by the work of Giorgi Gago Gagoshidze and Sarah Browne though other artist and activist practices

Mint is a new art space in Stockholm located in the former facilities of Sveagalleriet 19611992 in the ABF house on Sveav√§gen 41 Through art Mint expands from movements in time Historical political and geographical Here exhibitions study circles and a programme is arranged Initiated by Emily Fahl√©n and Asrin Haidari In collaboration with ABF Stockholm Konstfr√§mjandet Stockholm and the Swedish Labour Movements Archive and Library

Making development inclusive Welcome to an important and inspiring seminar

Programme
Moderator Kristina Ljungros
830 Registration coffee and sandwich
900 Welcome Kristina Ljungros Secretary General The Swedish Asthma and Allergy Association
905 Leaving No One Behind Jesper Hans√©n Secretary General MyRight

945 How to ensure disability inclusive water sanitation and hygiene projects Martina Nee Programme Manager Equity  Inclusion WaterAid
1010 Working with Umbrella organisations Bernard Bagweneza Regional Coordinator MyRight Africa

1045 Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights and Disability
Sara √ñsterlund Senior SRHR advisor RFSU
1100 Working with organisations by and for women with disabilities Sujana Shakya Acting Regional Coordinator MyRight Asia
1115 Short Film
1120 Promoting rights for people living with disability Anna Maria Drew PMU Regional Manager Asia
1135 Fighting poverty requires inclusion Leana Acevedo Regional Coordinator MyRight Latin America
1145 Closing notes

Registration anmalanmyrightse no later than May 16th

Discrimination and lack of access mean that disability often leads to poverty and measures to reduce poverty rarely or never reach persons with disabilities How can development actors ensure the inclusion and development of persons with disabilities

Through examples from different areas this seminar aims to give an overview on the effects of working for rights of persons with disabilities and contribute to a more disabilityinclusive development

At the seminar you will learn how to become a more inclusive organisation and how you can start up or extend your cooperation work with disability organisations Stories lessons learned and best practices will be shared as well as facts about the situation for persons with disabilities around the world

The seminar will be held in English The seminar will be interpreted in Swedish sign language The venue has a loopset and is wheelchair accessible Please let us know other accessibility needs when you registrate for instance if you need material or presentations in advance

Welcome to an important and inspiring seminar

Imagining Russian Regions IRES invites you to a seminar with Professor Susan SmithPeter the City University of New York based on her book Imagining Russian Regions Subnational Identity and Civil Society in NineteenthCentury Russia In the book Professor SmithPeter shows how ideas of civil society encouraged the growth of regional identity in Russia before 1861 Adam Smith and GWF Hegel‚Äôs ideas of civil society influenced Russians and the resulting plans to stimulate the growth of civil society also formed regional provincial and district identities

It challenges the view of the provinces as empty space found in the works of Nikolai Gogol who rejected the new nonnoble provincial identity and welcomed a nobleonly district identity By 1861 the nonnoble and noble public would come together to form a multiestate provincial civil society whose promise was not fulfilled due to the decision of the government to keep the peasant estate institutionally separate

Susan SmithPeter works on Russian history beyond the two capitals of Moscow and St Petersburg Beginning with a study of identity in the provinces of European or central Russia she has branched out to investigate the regional identity of the Russian North and Siberia as well She has published a wide range of articles on topics related to civil society and regional identity as well as Imagining Russian Regions Subnational Identity and Civil Society in NineteenthCentury Russia with Brill in 2018

We look forward to seeing you at IRES

EveNamn: Sexuality and Social Control in the Postwar USSR
EveBesk:
Sexuality and Social Control in the Postwar USSR IRES invites you to a seminar with a guest scholar Dr Siobhan Hearne Durham University who will talk about how medical knowledge intersected with issues of social control in the postwar Latvian SSR

In the early 1970s officials described the Latvian Soviet Socialist Republic as the second most diseased republic in the entire USSR in terms of venereal infection Experts claimed that between 1967 and 1972 the number of registered cases of gonorrhoea doubled and incidence of syphilis increased 36 times over These shocking statistics caught the attention of central government in Moscow who demanded that law enforcement organs and medical authorities in the Latvian SSR urgently develop solutions to the problem

Rather than addressing the structural issues that led to an increase in rates of infection Soviet leadership blamed the increase on the ‚Äòmoral debauchery‚Äô antisocial behaviour and ignorance of swathes of the population Physicians at venereological clinics around the Latvian SSR presented venereal diseases as illnesses contracted by citizens who engaged in any form of antiSoviet behaviour ranging from casual sex to criminal activity Throughout the 1960s and 1970s the Latvian Ministry of Health embarked on an antiVD propaganda offensive across all available media outlets Leaflets radio programmes television broadcasts and newspaper articles mixed practical advice about sexual hygiene with explicit instructions regarding appropriate Soviet sexual behaviour Law enforcement organs worked with medical personnel to prosecute individuals believed be spreading maliciously venereal diseases across the republic

This seminar will be based on a paper focused on the Latvian SSR to examine how medical knowledge intersected with issues of social control in the postwar Soviet Union Drawing on files from the Latvian State and Party Archives it will explore how Soviet leadership attempted to use criminal law and sex education to regulate sexual behaviour and the challenges faced by medical personnel and law enforcement in the application of state policy

Siobh√°n Hearne is a Leverhulme Early Career Fellow in the School of Modern Languages  Cultures at Durham University Her research focuses on the history of gender and sexuality in the Russian Empire and the Soviet Union She received her PhD from the University of Nottingham in 2017 and completed a Leverhulme Study Abroad Fellowship at the University of Latvia the year after Her forthcoming monograph examines the state regulation of prostitution in the Russian Empire in the decades before 1917 and this will be published by Oxford University Press in 20202021 She has published articles about prostitution and venereal diseases in the journals Kritika Social History and Revolutionary Russia

Biografin Frans Josef  kejsare i katastrofernas tid utkom h√∂sten 2018 Inspirationen till boken √§r Ulf Irhedens intresse f√∂r Centraleuropa och f√∂r den habsburgska dynastins m√•ngnationella rike Boken ‚Äì som publicerades samtidigt med hundra√•rsminnet av det √∂sterrikiskungerska kejsarrikets fall i november 1918  fyller en lucka i svensk bokutgivning Den str√§var inte enbart efter att skildra en h√§rskare och hans tid utan √§ven att skildra ett m√•ngfacetterat rike vars kulturella blomstring √•ren kring 1900 skapade verk som √§nnu har kvar sin lyskraft Samtidigt slets riket s√∂nder av etniska konflikter och av den slutliga katastrofen i form av f√∂rsta v√§rldskriget Den personhistoriska skildringen av Frans Josefs liv varvas med redog√∂relser f√∂r den politiska utvecklingen och milit√§ra och kulturhistoriska perspektiv

Mer information om boken hittar du h√§r httpswwwadlibriscomsebokfransjosefkejsareikatastrofernastid9789163977527

The Pontic Steppe Cossackdom 17751830s IRES invites you to a seminar entitled The Pontic Steppe Cossackdom 17751830s from borderland brotherhood to imperial estate with Dr Andriy Posunko E√∂tv√∂s Lor√°nd University

The Russian advance into the Pontic Steppe in the late 18th ct Treaty of K√º√ß√ºk Kaynarca 1774 Russian annexation of Crimea 1783 caused an unparalleled population movement in the region On the one hand local communities nomadic Tatars Cossacks frontier brotherhoods etc felt uneasy with imperial centralizing policies and started to migrate to the Ottoman lands in hope to preserve their traditional rights and privileges On the other the Russian government started its own colonization program of the region both inviting foreign colonists from Europe and resettling peasants from other provinces of the empire and attempting to create the attractive image of the region contrary to the previous Wild Field populated only by nomadic raiders Finally the end of every RussianTurkish war meant another influx of population into the Pontic Steppe  New Russia region  refugees and volunteers from the Balkans who were helping the Russian army and feared the Ottoman retribution
Consequently taking into account the borderland nature of the region and its highlymobile multicultural population with shifting loyalties in my presentation I propose a revisionist take on the incorporation of the Pontic Steppe into the Russian Empire at the turn of the eighteenthnineteenth centuries and the ambiguous legal status of local cossacks who had to adapt to the imperial rule To do so I primarily focus on three contexts local context of the Zaporozhian cossackdom allimperial context of the Russian military reforms as well as the development of imperial social structure ie more complex legislation on imperial estates sosloviia transimperial context of numerous entanglements between the Romanov Ottoman and Habsburg empires

Dr Andriy Posunko defended his PhD thesis at Central European University in 2018 and his research focused on the social and military history of cossack units in the Pontic Steppe region of the Russian Empire Andriy‚Äôs other publications also dealt with peculiarities of irregular military service in New Russia Bessarabia and Caucasus transimperial movement of people goods and ideas between Russian Ottoman and Habsburg empires as well as ambiguities of social and legal status of the inhabitants in the borderlands contested by these three empires

Currently Andriy is a postdoctoral fellow at Eotvos Lorand University where he teaches courses on interimperial encounters and entanglements in the Eastern and SouthEastern Europe as well as continues his research on the imperial transformations in the Pontic Steppe region during the late eighteenth  early nineteenth centuries

Lecture ‚ÄúRussia as Food Superpower‚Äù IRES invites to you a lecture on Russias changing food exports with Professor Stephen K Wegren from Southern Methodist University USA

Following his May 2018 inauguration President Vladimir Putin signed a decree on strategic tasks for national development to 2024 which instructed that nonenergy exports rise to 250 billion According to the decree food exports should increase to 45 billion by 2024 representing more than a doubling over the 2017 level when they reached almost 21 billion

Increased food export would give the Kremlin enhanced global status and provide more leverage to use food trade as an instrument of foreign policy The 45 billion level would rank Russia eighth among food exporting nations in 2017 behind Canada and before Spain A doubling of food exports would broaden and deepen Russia‚Äôs global market penetration and increase Russia‚Äôs projection of soft power into food insecure regions

The purpose of the presentation is to analyse Russia‚Äôs prospects for doubling the value of its food exports to 2024 The talk will be organised around two main questions 1 Can food supply increase to support a doubling of food exports by 2024 2 Do demandside factors among Russia‚Äôs main food customers facilitate or hinder an expansion of Russia‚Äôs food exports

Through an analysis of supply and demand variables Prof Wegren argues that despite the existence of myriad obstacles Russia stands a better than even chance of reaching the export goal posited by Putin

Stephen K Wegren is Professor of Political Science at Southern Methodist University US He is the author or editor of 17 books on the political economy of postcommunist nations He has also published over 150 articles and book chapters in a wide range of journals and books His research has been supported by the Social Science Research Council the National Council for Eurasian and East European Research the Ford Foundation the International Research and Exchanges Board OXFAM and the Norwegian Research Council Among his monographs are The Moral Economy Reconsidered Russia‚Äôs Search for Agrarian Capitalism 2005 Land Reform in Russia Institutional Design and Behavioral Responses 2009 Rural Inequality in Divided Russia 2014 His latest book is Food Policy and Food Security Putting Food on the Russian Table with Alexander Nikulin and Irina Trotsuk published in 2018 He is currently working on a book titled Russia‚Äôs Food Revolution

EveNamn: Pseudoconservatism in Russian society and politics
EveBesk:
Pseudoconservatism in Russian society and politics IRES invites you to an extra seminar with a visiting scholar Dr Alexey Zhavoronkov from Russian Academy of Sciences

The rising of the rightwing nationalist movements and parties during the current decade is accompanied by the new popularity of pseudoconservative strategies which successfully adapt themselves to both authoritarian and nonauthoritarian types of societies In Eastern Europe and Russia these theoretically and practically inconsistent forms of social and political action promoted by many as unique remedies against a supposed crisis of tradition are currently most prominent While somewhat different in their choice of ‚Äòtraditional‚Äô arguments depending on the country pseudoconservative strategies have common distinctive traits such as the hostility towards the current status quo the willingness to take risks and the creative spontaneity of decisionmaking

In Russia pseudoconservatism has become a dominant political strategy after the annexation of Crimea although this phenomenon is often confused with the Renaissance of conservatism The main focus of this seminar will be on the pseudoconservative instrumentalization of religious ethical legal social and political models of the past for the sake of explaining and justifying present actions The lack of consensus on the main traits of the Russian cultural identity which according to the rhetoric of pseudoconservatism has to be preserved at any cost makes possible the symbiotic coexistence of several rationally incompatible strategies which take their inspiration from different historical periods The goal of the presentation will be to explain the mechanism of this coexistence and to describe the chief characteristic features of the contemporary Russian pseudoconservatism

Alexey Zhavoronkov is senior researcher at the Institute of Philosophy of the Russian Academy of Sciences in Moscow He has received his first PhD in Classical Philology at the Lomonosov Moscow State University in 2010 In 2013 he has successfully defended his doctoral thesis in philosophy at the Humboldt University of Berlin His doctoral study in Germany was funded by a fellowship of the Konrad Adenauer Foundation Between 2013 and 2017 he worked as postdoctoral researcher in Berlin Weimar and Erfurt The key fields of his research are German philosophy of the 19th and 20th century most prominently Nietzsche and Arendt philosophical anthropology and social philosophy His current project focuses on the cognitive ethical and social role of exceptions which along with norms are an integral part of our everyday life The main goal of his work in Uppsala is to study the differences between the conservative and the pseudoconservative model of action in contemporary Russian society and politics ‚Äì from the perspective of the role of exceptions which depend on our decisions

EveNamn: Workshop NonRecognised Entities under International and EU Law
EveBesk:
Workshop NonRecognised Entities under International and EU Law The Institute for Russian and Eurasian Studies IRES in cooperation with the University of Graz Austria and National University of KyivMohyla Academy Ukraine cordially invite you to take part in an international workshop entitled ‚ÄúNonRecognised Entities under International and EU Law‚Äù

The purpose of the event is to discuss theoretical and practical issues related to the phenomenon of legal systems of nonrecognised entities in Europe ranging from Abkahzia and South Ossetia to Donetsk and Lugansk and NagornoKarabakh and Transnistria The event will focus on international UN and EU‚Äôs policies towards nonrecognised entities The issue of selfdetermination of Catalonia under Spanish Constitutional law is also to be discussed The participants of the workshop represent universities in Austria Georgia Germany Italy the Netherlands Russia Spain the UK and Ukraine They bridge the issues of international law EU external policy EU sanctions policy and legal systems of nonrecognised entities under the framework of law in context analysis Contributions of the participants will lead to a collective monograph publication

WORKSHOP INFO
From seed to plant
Do you have a dream that you wish to realize 100
Do you know how to sing and swing with your inner Dragons to create your dream team

Welcome to a four day workshop with a unique duo Marco Steiger from Zurich one of the world‚Äôs leading Dragon Dreaming trainers and Peder Karlsson from Sweden professor of rhythmic choir leadership and cofounder and exsinger of the a cappella group The Real Group

Marco facilitates exercises where you and the other participants explore the four basic stages of Dragon Dreaming dreaming planning doing celebrating  which also includes creating a game plan for your dream team and project Trust the process and let your dream come true‚Äù

Peder contributes with unique tools for how to find your inner rhythms and your inner notes through body awareness and cocreative interaction
These tools are adapted to all kinds of people regardless of previous musical knowledge and regardless of whether you believe that you can sing or not

‚ÄùDragon Dreaming is a process of unconditional love in action based on the principle that the source to a successful project is the inherent power and relations of people with each other and with their environment Dragon Dreaming is a combination of old and new knowledge  a lifepromoting jointly organized and purposeful practice grounded in Aboriginal traditional wisdom combined with modern project design‚Äù
 John Croft the father and founder of Dragon Dreaming who lives in Australia

WARMLY WELCOME TO BAREFOOT GATHERING
With love from Rico  Maria with Guests musicians Johan and Cheikne

About Rico
Trained by and lived with a Malinkefamily in West Africa for many years Since then I have worked in various ways with music and also combining music with my other great interests presence meditation and community An example of the expression I work with is the music project H√§rvaro where meditation presence and communication through music is the key focus When Im in the music and dance in the art of living as I live and vibrate in a natural way Then Im here Im at home
Everything we do is rhythm By working with rhythm and identifying with it we can more easily find our own rhythm of life and thus an inner balance with ourselves our family and our environment   Rico

About Maria
I just LOVE to Dance and to provide dancespace and gather dancers My body and soul loves to move freely For me Dance is a fast and amazing way to get in contact with myself and to feel my inner my energy and essence I found 5 Rhythms 13 years ago and knew immediately that this was what I longed for That moving meditation as it is usually described as is my main inspiration and I have danced it a lot both in Sweden and in workshops abroad Since a few years I have shared my own dance Body  Soul Movement

About Johan
Ever since I could walk I loved to dance The movements brought me to the rhythm and since then rhythm is an essential part of my life I have lived in West Africa during periods in my life where I deepened my knowledge in traditional percussion and stringed instruments With the warm red sand under my feet I realized that music and dance are two branches of the same infinite source that promotes pure presence This force has saved me from pain stress and brought light to my life
The music is the most meditative state I find myself in and therefore I am deeply grateful to be part of Barefoot Gathering
‚ù§

About Cheickne Sissoko Mali
Having acquired the ability and skill to play the drum from his father Cheickne alone plays five superimposed tamans that give different musical notes at a time His first major concert was with the Instrumental Ensemble ASO JIGUI  directed by Massambou Wele Diallo Professor of Music at the National Institute of Arts and Conservatory two art schools in Mali at the last Congress of Moussa Traor√© President of Mali from 1968 to 1991 at the Hotel de lAmiti√© in Bamako He gained extensive experience with one of the beststructured cultural enterprises ACTE SEPT  in February and March 1997 which initiated research into other forms of M√©tis Theater called Theater in the street  for the purpose of an exchange spectatorsshow A seasoned artist Cheickn√® Sissoko is head of the troupe  SOMANE which specialises in only traditional instruments Cheickn√®s musical research goes to the very heart of the terroir to exploit and improve the tradition in all its components

MFA exhibition A Potential Recording Device ‚Äì Anders S Solberg A Potential Recording Device ‚Äì Anders S Solberg

Saturday ‚Äì Sunday 1200 ‚Äì 1600

Around 15 million years ago an insect was caught in the resin of a tree Over the following millions of years the tree resin was exposed to heat and pressure It became fossilised turned into amber The insect was preserved and the preservation is a recording In photographic terms it is a long exposure of an event crystallised into matter This is a way of reconfiguring the terms of what the material aspects of a recording is and by extension a novel way of looking at matter In this instance an insect is deposited inside of amber and this amber creates a barrier through which we perceive it To gain access to the creature trapped within the circumstances and setting of its entrapment must be decoded In this way the resin encapsulating it becomes part of the recording and inseparable from it just like the objects we surround ourselves with are also encased in an amber of sorts They are engulfed in their own histories their context and the specific time we encounter them in They store and record the intent of their makers

EveNamn: Wim Hof Method Breathing Experience Stockholm
EveBesk:
Wim Hof Method Breathing Experience Stockholm Breathing deep and conscious has a multitude of health benefits
Besides releasing hormones that make you strong healthy and happy you have a opportunity to release stuck energies and connect with yourself

In a group setting breathwork becomes amplified and helps us realign and balance ourselves

For about two hours we go together on a musical journey through breath sensation and relaxation to give a fantastic start into the weekend

We will use a simple yet powerful breathing technique from the Wim Hof method to bring you closer to understanding yourself and how to at will regulate your biochemistry

Welcome to a breathing experience that might change your whole view on what our breath is capable of

This will be a repeating event so you will have the chance to go deeper each week I will also provide a recording for participants to practice at home and love answering any questions that come up

To sign up and reserve your spot please swish 200 Kr to 0767069177 or write me
200 Kr per session and 500 Kr for all three together

Please come on an empty stomach two hours prior no food and bring an open mind

Welcome

Dario Fariello at Larrys Corner an evening of Improvised music featuring saxophones tubax samples modular synthesizer and samplers filtered through a feedbacker viola

httpsoundcloudcomdariofariello

DARIO FARIELLO is a saxophonist and violist devoted to improvised music He studied musicology at the University of Bologna where he cofounded the Bologna improvisers Orchestra After touring extensively in Europe and in the United States with the jazzcore band Luther Blissett he moved to Berlin in 2011 to work with Tristan Honsinger and the dj Eren Ileri he cofounded Multiversal a nomad festival series featuring a wide international network of improv and noise musiciansx000B Now based in Oslo his current projects include ZGB Sciardac Farantimm Resurgam Bad Bender a duo with B√•rd Torgersen FarielloVoglsinger FarLie In Its Own Tempo
He has collaborated with Gino Robair Eugene Chadbourne Butch Morris James Brown Calle Neumann Tristan Honsinger Alexei Borisov Olga Nosova Mia Zabelka Agnes Hvizdalek Tomomi Adachi Kenji Kuroda Ilia Belorukov Alexander Chernyshkov Marina Poleukhina Harri Sj√∂str√∂m Steve Heather
With Norbert Stammberger he organises the yearly Tubax Festival in Munich dedicated to the tubax saxophone and other special instruments

NordicChina HighTech Weeks in Lund üí• NCSF Lund is proud to present our first pitching competition part of our HighTech weeks with amazing prize and experienced juryüí•

¬∑ What is this event
NordicChina HiTech Weeks HTW is an annually recurring concept with several weeks of organized startup and tech matchmakingevents spread out over the year and in different Nordic and Chinese cities To elevate and connect the two ecosystems the Nordic Startups and the Chinese market in this event 9 startups will make to the final and 2 will be awarded with up to 10000 CNYapprox 1300EUR travel expense to attend our event November in China and enjoy our tailormade matchmaking program

NordicChina HiTech Weeks 2019 Lund is powered by VentureLab Ideon Science Park Folkuniversitetet and Oatly

¬∑ Who can sign up
Startups If you are a startup company in technology area and interested in entering Chinese market sign up  httpncsfnordicapiarycom

Participants If you are interested in technology innovation and startups register to get an exciting and inspiring afternoon  httpsncsf2019lundeventbritecom

Volunteers If you like to get new ideas if you are interested in Chinese market and love to build relationships with many enthusiastic and creative people or even be a member of NCSF Email us ‚úâ Leoncsfio

¬∑ What can you get
üëâAs a startup company you will get the chance to introduce your brilliant idea to many incubators investors and potential customers This is a perfect chance for branding inspiration and further cooperation In short we help you to APPROACH YOUR DREAM
üëâAs a participant you are more than welcome to the event for inspirations networking and even job or investment opportunities Besides more than just being an audience you have the right to VOTE FOR TEAMS You will have a close touch with techoriented startups innovative projects and creative people
üëâAs a volunteer you can gain experience in holding events you get the opportunity to build your networks and also to improve yourself MAKE A DIFFERENCE

INTERESTED Follow the event and save the date
Contact lundncsfio by email if you have any question

The Art of Analysing Games
Video games are textbooks for good game design you just need to learn how to read them In this talk Game Maker‚Äôs Toolkit creator Mark Brown shares his tips and techniques for understanding games  from studying mechanics to charting out levels

EveNamn: SAMA Yoga Teacher Training module 3 with Sky and the Sama Yoga
EveBesk:
SAMA Yoga Teacher Training module 3 with Sky and the Sama Yoga
The Sama Yoga Teacher Training YTT involves a full understanding of Yoga not only on the mat but as a way of living that gives harmony and joy in your life

To book this retreat please contact the teacher directly via email to yogadeepeninggmailcom ‚ô•Ô∏è

   

Dear Yogis

I wish to welcome you all to this journey of selfgrowth and discovery of how Yoga can help transform our lives It‚Äôs a special marker in your life when you decide to commit to understanding yourself more clearly and take care of your health and wellbeing

Finding your voice and expression of yoga as a teacher is a beautiful way to deepen your understanding and share the blessings of what you‚Äôve learned To truly convey the heart of yoga one requires to live a life of yoga practice consistently for sometime and grasp the most subtle of understandings the nature of oneself

Our exploration together spans over 9 months like a pregnancy we grow in the womb of Sama Yoga practices and assimilated life values cultivating healthy habits and emotional stability and open heart

We move chant sing pray stretch breathe challenge accept assimilate invigorate and learn to listen to our hearts On behalf of the great SamaYoga team we are honoured and inspired to share with you what has profoundly blessed our lives in every way

A wish for all students
May the studentsteachers of Sama Yoga gain the blessing of Moksa liberation from a sense of limitation and have the capacity to share with comfort and confidence the true teachings o yoga May all beings have freedom from suffering

Sky

     
WHY IS THE SAMA YOGA TEACHER TRAINING UNIQUE
1 Emphasis on SelfDevelopment
Sama Yoga presents a full yoga lifestyle how you can live in harmony with your environment and most importantly how we can mature and grow into responsible stable spiritual people that honors and lives a life in accordance with human values We learn about asana meditation Puja Prayers Devotion Emotional management proper chanting Mantra and meanings of mantras psychology and how the consistent practice of these disciplines earns us grace and blessings in the life

2 The yoga classes are uniquely presented
The Yoga is delivered straight from the heart from a deep trust in the yoga wisdom and knowledge to flow from teacher to student It is delivered as a prayer

3 The physical presentation
It is an integration of Hatha Yoga Kriyas Qi gong and heart opening mantras intuitively delivered in a relaxed way that honors the students and lets them feel comfortable the whole way through There‚Äôs a sense of continuous flow even in the stillness the poses lead gracefully from one to another allowing the practitioner to go deeply into the sensations feeling the more subtle aspects of the pose

4 Learn how to teach with your heart and full presence
While teaching Yoga we take great care to use language that is appropriate and nonmanipulative so the students can truly trust and relax

5 It takes a commitment
The students get a good understanding how to perform the Asanas and practice teaching them to the group We devote 2 classes per day to being on the yoga mat and engaging in Hatha yoga both in flow and structure solo and group work Yoga is a commitment to cognitive and emotional maturity The teaching is there and guides us as to how to do this We commit to practice Yoga Asanas and Pranayama as a means of stabilizing the mind and body See what happens when you commit to a daily practice of nadi shodana for 6 months or longer

6 Personal programs are prescribed for all Teacher Trainees
Sky meets all students individually seeing where they are at what is the physicalemotional state of the person and what they can focus on in between the 3 segments Personal programs are not set in stone and sometimes altered accordingly to the changing needs of the student

7 We learn and practice Japa Sadhana ‚Äìrepetition of Mantra
This is a rich resource for the student and all students are initiated into Mant raJapa They are encouraged to chant every day and over time they can gain deeper and deeper focus and devotion in the chanting This is a great way to learn to manage our thoughts when we repeat the same sacred words over and over we clearly see what thought patterns pop up

8 We get to travel to Bali
The 10 days in Bali are special indeed By the ocean warm away from all familiar forms on a magical spiritual island where the people are living in prayer To grow we need to stretch our comfort zones sacrifice some of our personal likes and dislikes ‚Äì see what happens when we show up in a different culture

9 We get classes with a very rare traditional teacher
A Swamiji master who deeply understands the purpose of yoga and has practiced it lived it thoroughly and taught for 40 years

Swami Vagishananda Saraswati has been an important aspect of this training teaching us traditional Vedanta and yoga lifestyle as taught in the Bhagavad Gita Swamiji takes the role of a seeingeye dog and guides us with words to see what we truly ARE to see the essence of ourselves that is unaffected by the various states of the body and the mind We get to ask questions about the nature of oneself the world and God The purpose of this teaching is to help us be content in ourselves by ourselves no matter what happens in body and mind Sri Swamiji is a rare jewel indeed we are blessed to have classes in Bali with a teacher so deep and so available to share this knowledge clearly

   

The cost for this retreat is 48000 kr

The price includes shared accomodation all of the workshops all of the meals and accommodation in shared room and transfer to and from train station at Skinnskatteberg 5 mins away

To book this retreat please contact the teacher directly via email to yogadeepeninggmailcom ‚ô•Ô∏è

Song of the Heart  Through Kundalini Yoga and Sacred Sound

Finding the song of the heart is a gift that leads to great prosperity and joy This workshop lead by Snatam Kaur is designed to find that song We will begin with powerful Kundalini Yoga combining breath movement posture and meditation to open the energy systems of the body and release emotional energy We will then open the voice with vocal exercises Finally we will dive into the ecstasy of Sacred Sound with a Mantra from Snatam Kaur‚Äôs album Beloved httpwwwsnatamkaurcomnewalbum called Har Har Har Har Gobinday This Mantra brings the power to self elevate out of neurosis and hardship into the beautiful place where the song of the heart vibrates

IN ENGLISH

Experience the joyous and uplifting music of Snatam Kaur At this concert she will offer songs from her album Beloved and many other popular favorites

With an enchanting mixture of traditional holy mantras and compositions with eastern and western influences alike her previous albums Prem Grace Anand Liberation‚Äôs Door and Light of the Naam have inspired listeners and brought them a deep sense of inner peace But the best way to experience Snatam Kaur‚Äôs warmth wisdom and music is through a live performance

‚ÄúConcerts give audiences the opportunity to experience the power of mantra‚Äù says Snatam Kaur ‚ÄúI know from my own experience that it is super healing and powerful to chant together It allows us to release stress tension and the feeling of being overwhelmed which I think is fairly common in this day and age It‚Äôs a way for people to find that sense of inner peace‚Äù

Snatam Kaur is an American singer peace activist and author who grew up in a Sikh and Kundalini Yoga tradition She has a fantastic ability to transform traditional Sikh songs from India into modern music that speaks to the modern ear

EveBesk:
SFX  FX Workshop 10 Day Silicone Mask Making Class
Join our 10day silicone mask making workshop at Helsinglight FX Makeup Academy Sweden Learn the art of designing sculpting mold making silicone casting airbrushing

The course is mainly held in Swedish and English We can also assist in Finnish if any course participant is in need of it

Read about the workshop in Swedish httpshelsinglightcomblog2018121710dagarsmaskkursisilikonhelsinglightfx

Video from our silicone mask making workshop
httpsyoutubejviU3cQnjQ

Workshop dates Thursday 2 May ‚Äì Sunday 12 May 2019
Workshop hours 9 am ‚Äì 5 pm
Where Helsinglight FX Vattl√•ng 114 Sweden
Cost EUR 1695  SEK 16 950

We will supply all tools and materials you need to create a mask in silicone If you wish to add certain features to your mask and character ie hair props costume certain FX lenses or makeup etc you can buy some products at our workshop or bring stuff with you We will go through your character design and see what is possible or not during this workshop

Former Students
If you are a former student of Helsinglight FX Academy you are automatically a member of Helsinglight FX Community and eligible for a 20  discount on fees for our courses

Class Size
14 peopleworkshop Minimum 6 people
Recommended minimum age 18 years old

No prior knowledge in mask making is needed our workshops are for both beginners and advanced

Travel and Accommodation
Getting here is super easy Were located 25 hours north of Stockholm by train and we will pick you up at the train station in Hudiksvall when you arrive or guide you on the bus We are happy to help you out with your travel plans tips for accommodation during your stay

More information on wwwhelsinglightcom or email petrahelsinglightcom with your questions or booking


ABOUT OUR 10DAY FX MASK MAKING WORKSHOP

1 CHARACTER DESIGN  SCULPTING 4 DAYS
Concept  character design sketching or mood board pictures Sculpt your design and full mask in clay Learn different sculpting techniques

2 MOLD MAKING 3 DAYS
Learn how to make a 2part stone mold Clean and prepare your stone mold for silicone casting

3 SILICONE CASTING  AIRBRUSH  HAND PAINTING OF MASK 2 DAYS
Mix measure and coloring of silicone Brushon technique of silicone into mold Clean patch and prepare your mask for paintwork

4 CHARACTER MAKEOVER AND PHOTOSHOOT 1 DAY
Makeover and photo shoot of your character with a professional photographer Add FX Makeup FXlenses costumes props etc for a more realistic final look and feel

EveNamn: Coming Home to Oneself with Luke Bache
EveBesk:
Coming Home to Oneself with Luke Bache
Welcome to a 4 day retreat of yoga meditation silence and workshops of Buddhist philosophy combined with psychotherapeutic concepts and nonviolent communication techniques

Coming home to oneself through love and acceptance navigating the ups and downs of life from a wiser place

httpswwwshambalagatheringscomproductcominghometooneselfwithlukebache

This retreat has several focuses

Breathing
How to breathe to calm the nervous system thus remaining calm more resilient and less emotionally reactive in daily life

Psychotherapeutic Concepts We will take a deeper look at the layers of self to understand our different behaviors better and to look at the different personality structures that we have built Once we have a deeper understanding it is much easier to integrate these partsbehaviors compassionately for a greater feeling of wholeness

Buddhist Philosophy and meditation
We will use mindfulness practices to help us find that place of rest amidst the inevitable ups and downs of everyday life

Yoga We will use Tantric yogic techniques that work with the energy body and there will be classes of vinyasa and yin

NonViolent Communication
We will use techniques from this wonderful form of communication that can help us feel into our needs and express them in a wiser way An amazing tool in day to day relating

Silence
There will be Silence from Friday morning until Sunday morning This is a chance to really take a deeper look inside to slow down and become more intimate with oneself

There will be a talk before about the power of silence and some of the challenges one might face during this period Please know I am available during this period if you are struggling and need to talk to us

     
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
The workshops will be taught in English All levels are welcome no experience of yoga or meditation are required

The retreat will be held at Borntorpet Shambala Gatherings located in the forests of Bergslagen around Skinnskatteberg Except of joining the yoga classes and workshops you will also encounter the Shambala community who with open arms receives and serves the guests with a heart warming and homely family atmosphere The food is vegan gluten free inspired by Ayurveda and locally produced vegetables and honey

The cost for this retreat is
Early Bird price 3900 kr pay before 28th of February
Full Price 4500 kr

The price includes shared accomodation all of the workshops all of the meals and accommodation in shared room and transfer to and from train station at Skinnskatteberg 5 mins away

httpswwwshambalagatheringscomproductcominghometooneselfwithlukebache

Borderlands Open Workshop
Borderlands play a significant part throughout European history On the grounds of borderlands Europe has seen a wide array of political disputes and cultural construction of borders Outside Europe borderlands were laid out when the Europeans met the peoples across the oceans and European states turned to expansionist ventures eastwards Within Europe the significance of borderlands are related to processes as a growing number of recognized nationalities and Europeanisation

The aim of the workshop is to enhance reflections on European borderlands We want to bring together the researchers who are studying borderlands and the setting of borders throughout history We want to accomplish a better knowledge of what we are accomplishing in this field and attempt to find common research questions

As a common platform we use the brief description of the new course European Borderlands at the European master program at the University of Gothenburg Throughout history people have erected borders against the outside the unfamiliar and ‚Äúthe other‚Äù Lines of separation have appeared in different forms and for different reasons Borders have sometimes been the result of conscious choices other times of unintended developments and contingencies Walls and fences maps legislative acts new technologies and discoveries ideological constructions scientific and pseudoscientific categorizations cultural expressions and social customs have all served to organize territory and shape perceptions of community and identity But borders whether spatial or mental physical or cultural have neither been static nor impermeable For centuries new lines of divisions new perceptions of ‚Äúus‚Äù and ‚Äúthem‚Äù and new mechanisms for exclusion and inclusion have emerged moved and dissolved while in the process defining and shaping the European experience Within and between dominant political economic and cultural regimes there have always been spaces of considerable fluidity and exchange Spanning from the earliest encounters with the peoples and societies of the New World to the rise of the European nationstates this course builds on the multidisciplinary and rapidly growing field of borderland studies to examine the historical underpinnings of the great challenges facing Europe today httpkursplanergusepdfkursenEU2114

EveBesk:
Women¬¥s Health  Yoga Training with Sofia Araujo 20 Hours Yoga A
Women¬¥s Health  Yoga Training with Sofia Araujo
20 Hours
Yoga Alliance Continuing Education Certified
this course is open to everyone all levels welcome

17th ‚Äì 19th May
friday 1620
Saturday and Sunday 918

This training was developed to introduce a yoga philosophy and practice designed for women¬¥s bodies and cycles
The practices and traditions draw their inspiration from Yoga Ayurveda Traditional Chinese Medicine Taoism Tantra and Shamanism and aim to reconnect you to your innate wisdom as a woman
The course is a combination of energetic practices and theme explorations for women of all backgrounds to embody their own rhythm understand the inner landscapes of emotion and thought as well as the cultivation of awareness vital energy Shakti and selfcare

Topics Covered

The Holistic Health model for the female body
Understanding the qualities and archetypes of the menstrual cycle
Understanding PMS according to Traditional Chinese Medicine
Meridian movement  yoga poses to better support our cycles and organs
Selfcare practices based in Ayurveda and TCM
Connecting creativity  sexuality
Emotional health and sovereignty
Sound mantra and expression
Designing yoga sequences for personal practice
Feminine Leadership
Tea Ceremony

Who is this course for

This course if for any woman independently which phase of life you¬¥re at The principles are simple to understand and you¬¥ll get guidance on how to apply it in your daily living
If you are a yoga teacher this is a fundamental course so you can transmit these principles to your yoga students and create a community of women embodied in their femininity by the way they move express and practice selfcare

About Sofia

Sofia Araujo is a yoga teacher therapist macrobiotic chef and holistic health educator that shares a passion for healthy movement and living She is trained in the alchemy of the 5 Elements through Yoga Ayurveda Macrobiotic Nutrition and Counseling Ayurvedic Yoga Massage and Chi Nei Tsang Visceral Massage with over 1500 hours of certified yoga studies

Her ability to listen people through their movements breath rhythms and nature cycles is what makes her a skillful yoga therapist teacher and holist health counselor She offers a view on the human experience that is rich in mindful movement and committed in living in harmony with the principles of Nature

She is the director of international Swara Yoga School and has traveled to over 30 countries to educate and inspire growth In the last few years she feels a deep call to share with women her 16 years of yoga experience and facilitate the process of recognizing Spirit through the harmony of body and mind

As a social entrepreneur she sponsors several social projects in developing countries through the Swara Yoga School trainings to promote Yoga and Meditation in unprivileged communities and minorities

SPRING BEAST FESTIVAL 2019

For the fifth consecutive year Spring Beast is one of the worlds biggest graffiti festivals located at Sn√∂s√§tra Gr√§nd Europes largest legal graffiti exhibition 4500 m2

Spring Beast is a grassroots initiative to encourage urban culture and free expression in its purest form

This is a festival for everyone no matter what age gender ethnicity or shoe size you got
Come as you are leave as you be

Robin Simon and Pauls met each other in the autumn of 2018 in Gothenburg Sweden Very soon they realized they had similar musical taste and they started Jamming standards and rehearsing their original material After a couple of months working together they played their first tryout concert and it became clear that this was only the beginning of a beautiful project



During this concert they will present you a selection of their own songs alongside arrangements and interpretations of standards and original tunes The music they will perform and the sound they have as a band is heavily influenced by world class musicians such as Bill Stewart Peter Bernstein John Scofield Sam Yahel Larry Goldings Wayne Shorter Kenny Wheeler and many more Everybody is welcome to drop by and enjoy the music

EveBesk:
International Biodiversity Day Tales from the field
Field research can be a hard process that often involves heavy rains runins with selfappointed authorities flat tires animal
bites and more Come hear researchers tell about their fieldwork adventures

Our speakers are
Christine Bacon an Assistant Professor at the University of Gothenburg Sweden She is a botanist working on the systematics and evolution of palms

Harith Farooq a PhD student at Gothenburg University working with conservation and biogeography of amphibians and reptiles in Mozambique

Kennet Lundin an Associate Professor in Marine Biology He is studying the biodiversity of marine invertebrates such as nudibranchs His travels take him to the seas in Indonesia and the Philippines but also to Arizonas deserts and the Andes mountains

Mafe Torres a postdoc at the University of Gothenburg She uses DNA to understand how new species arise

Magnus Gelang PhD in Vertebrate Zoology He is studying birds and bats with focus on the biodiversity in the Old world and is extra found of field work in the Southeast Asia

Magnus Lid√©n a researcher in systematic botany Mapping the worlds biodiversity within the plant kingdom His excursions have been to India China and Iran

In collaboration with Gothenburg Global Biodiversity Centre

Four yoga sessions an hour each 18001900 on four consequent Wednesdays May 1st 8th 15th 22nd

Each session consists of
 Yoga asanas postures which help you to stretch release tension from the body and becoming more flexible They also help in controlling the inner organs and glands and their hormonal secretions which affect many different physical functions and emotional as well Any over or under production of hormones can lead to imbalanced emotions Yoga asanas help to regulate the production of these hormones and balance their related emotions
 Yoga dance Kaoshiki which can cure more than 22 diseases including liver problems pancreas female reproductive disorders gout arthritis and stiffness It exercises the spine the organs the glands and the different chakras It promotes youthfulness and It is great for curing depression and melancholy increasing memory calming promoting positive thinking and expanding the mind
 Proper breathing with different tips on how to use breathing for increasing focus calming the mind improving digestion controlling metabolism etc
 Relaxation for body and mind
 Short meditation ending each session

Guided by Shantimaya a yoga and meditation teacher wwwyogameditationstockholmse

Designed for both beginners and advanced

The course is limited to a small number of participants and your experience of the course will be very personalized

Pecha Kucha Night 36
Pecha Kucha is a format where interesting people will hold a series of small talk about any topic that interests them All talks consist of 20 slides that are shown in 20 seconds each and are 6 minutes and 40 seconds long

Some talks will be in Swedish some in English

There is no entrance fee and the event is open to anyone It is an evening filled of unexpected insights and interesting stories As always there will be an option to but some lighter food and drinks both wine beer and coffee

BIO
This April and May respected Canadian singersongwriter Jerry Leger will be returning to Europe accompanied by Dan Mock on bassvocals and Kyle Sullivan on drumsvocals both from his longtime band The Situation A limited edition Europeanonly compilation titled Too Broke To Die  A Retrospective
20052019 will coincide with the tour and be available at shows only
It features songs taken from all 9 releases plus two outtakes 33year old Leger has received praise in Rolling Stone Pop Matters No Depression Americana UK and from fellow songwriters such as Ron Sexsmith a couple Too Broke To Die tracks feature Sexsmith Jim Lauderdale and Michael Timmins of Cowboy Junkies who is also Legers producerlabel head at Latent Recordings yet hes remained somewhat undertheradar Im sure he wouldnt mind commercial success but perhaps the career as a cult artist suits him better as in the same fashion as songwriters like John Prine and Tom Waits Both sold modestly but were highlyregarded artists
for half of their careers before becoming musical legends and like these writers Leger is prolific uncompromising and fixated on artistic success The examples are throughout Too Broke To Die and
promote further listening of his already large and impressive body of work Last year Leger made his European debut with two tours in support of his acclaimed double LP Nonsense and Heartache Latent WarnerProper They included dates with Trampled By Turtles Sarah Shook  The Disarmers and the Take

Yoga Anatomy Workshop  Ashtanga
A unique opportunity to take a deep dive into your practice and deepen your knowledge in anatomy Stu has been teaching yoga related anatomy for the last 7 years both on teacher trainings and international workshops He has been practicing yoga for 15years has a BSc Hons in Health Studies and for the last 10 years has been offering Therapeutic Bodywork exclusively for yoga practitioners The underlying philosophy that guides what he shares is that knowledge is of no value unless we can understand how to use it and have use for it With this in mind the workshops he offers focus on what makes us individual how can we understand our limitations and restrictions and how can we avoid injury and create balance Stu endeavours to bring as much fun and practical experimentation into every workshop and emphasises the importance of getting to grips with the concepts rather that getting bogged down in the detail

‚ÄçThis weekend we also add to this the possibility of an ashtanga yoga practice with authorized teachers Camilla Silver  Johan Lundback

‚ÄçFriday
